Reviews.Title: “What a pool deck !”
Reviews.Author: scott b
Reviews.Content: We stayed in an individual owner's room on the 1st floor adjacent to the pool. The room was really maintained well. Very clean. The staff was very friendly and the entire building and grounds looked like they take great pride in their building. This is not a hotel, but a condo. But the best thing about our stay was the large pool right next to our room. We could walk out of our little patio right over to the pool and then just down the steps to the beach. The pool was very large and was cleaned everyday. Lots of pool chair and tables. Our room had a large refrigerator, 2 burner stove, microwave and a dinging table for 4. The room was not huge, but comfortable enough for the 3 of us. We had a great time and we'll be back at Harbour Beach !

Reviews.Title: “SMALL rooms”
Reviews.Author: Donna B
Reviews.Content: Well to start with, once we checked in and got to our rooms we were let down by how small the rooms were. I have stayed in condos at other beaches that were 1 bedroom with sleeper sofa which were fine, but in this one you hardly have room to turn around. You have to have a key to get into the building after 6 pm and a key to the vendor and exercise rooms and outside door to the pool plus a key to get out of pool area to the beach- which is very inconvenient when you are loaded down with stuff to carry. Also on day #2 of our visit there (which was the week after July 4th) for 8 hours there was an alarm check going on and the alarm sounded off every 10 mins for a FULL 8 hours (no nap for the kids that day!) and on day #3 they had to shut off all the water for pipe work for over 4 hours! They should have shut down the hotel for a day or two for this type maintenance in my opinion. There is no front desk and no attendant to ask any help from. As for the beach, there are cars allowed to park on the beach and this is definitely NOT a kid friendly beach. Daytona Beach will not be my choice for vacation next time!

Reviews.Title: “Not Bad for the price”
Reviews.Author: kbarry70
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this resort over the July 4th week. I rented a studio from a ;private owner. Although the place is a bit old they do very well with the up keep. My condo was fine, except it had a queen bed and I prefer a king. It had two burner stove, small refrigerator/freezer, plates, cups,utensils, coffee makers, etc. The owner also have beach umbrella and beach towels. The pool was awesome, huge even though on the 4th it was packed. Need a key to enter the pool and the beach area so it is awesome not having public come barging through the complex. It is very close to the pier and we walked most nights up and down the beach and the road. There is a splash park next door for the whole family. The all downfall is that there are some not so favorable homeless and drunks that use the park and are in an apt complex across the ways, however we were never bothered by anyone.

Reviews.Title: “DUMP”
Reviews.Author: Phrocano
Reviews.Content: By no means am I a "snob" but, my family and I stayed at the Westagte Villas in Kissimmee for a week prior to this which was great. We arrived at this location after booking 3 night and walked through the door and did not expect what we saw. Staff was helpful but the facility was a dump. We went to our room (#207) and the room keys did not work. Staff reprogrammed new key cards for us. Once we entered the room thre was a strong odor of cigarette smoke in the room. I walked out onto the landing and there was a used cigarette butt in front of the door on the floor and an even stronger odor of cigarette smoke. As I looked to my right there was a female sitting on her landing two doors down chain smoking. Needless to say we wouldnt be able to stay the night there because of the odor. My son has a breathing problem and my eyes itched almost instantly. This was a "non smoking" room according to staff. We opted to not stay and were reimbursed for 2 of the 3 nights. I would not recommend this to anyone that is looking for a quality room. Also, I would not even lay or sit on any of the furniture. Westgate should remove their name from this facility.

Reviews.Title: “Great potential....”
Reviews.Author: adipace815
Reviews.Content: We have been Westgate owners for 15 years, and have seen this resort on the Westgate web page and always wondered about it. Its our understanding that about half of this resort is owned by Westgate and the other half is privately owned. We like to stop in Daytona Beach on our annual visit to Orlando, and decided to rent a couple of nights at the Harbour Beach Resort through Westgate at the onwer rate. We were pleasantly suprised with our stay and think this resort has excellent potential. Our family travels to Florida 2-3 times per year and Daytona Beach is one of our favorite spots to stop for a few days of beach time. We have stayed at numerous beach front hotels in this area, and truthfully there are only a handful that we would revisit. This is one of the resorts we would probably consider returning to. The location is great, facility is pretty good and the price was right. The things we liked: The rooms are set up very nicely. You walk into the "master bedroom" which has a bathroom of its own. Having two bathrooms in a room that sleeps 4 is fabulous whether you are traveling with kids, teenagers or adult friends. There is a kitchen in between the master bedroom and a "living room" with a sofa sleeper. Its a nice set up because there is living space during the day when the couch is folded up. The kitchen is a bit bigger than a kitchenette and a tad smaller than a full kitchen. It does have everything you need in a kitchen though. A full refrigerator, stove, oven, microwave, coffee maker, and is well stocked with utensils. There is a small table for dining as well. Its a bit of an older building, but it was pretty well taken care of. Its not the facility that a timeshare owner may be used to, but overall was a pleasant surprise. Things we were less than excited about: The view from the balcony is as good as any other ocen front hotel; however there is no privacy whatsoever on the balcony. When you walk out of the room you are literally sitting next to the neighbor and can probably tell what they had for breakfast. Some lattice between the rooms would probably make it just private enough to be cozy. There isa very obvious effort towards security of the facility by resort management. Each room is issued two keys for use of facilities; which you must protect with your life or pay a $35 replacement fee if one is lost. The entrance to and from the lobby to the pool area, the lobby bathrooms, the excercise and game room, and entrance from the beach to the pool area are all locked and a key is needed for access. We had two rooms for our stay with 4 people in one room and 3 in the other. Trying to juggle the facility keys was a complete inconvenience. If Westgate/Harbour remain committed to securing the facility in this way they may want to consider swipe card access for the facility use keys as well. That way they can issue unlimited card keys to their guests. Just a suggestion. Another annoyance was the parking. Management was clearly having difficulty with non guest parking. They were constantly issuing warnings to guests about properly displaying their parking pass or they would be towed. I know I went to my car several times just to make sure the parking pass hadn't blown out or fell on the floor. Despite all of their efforts, we came back one evening after a trip to the airport for one of our party members, and there was not a parking place left in the resort. I had to park next door and risk being towed. Parking is a problem everywhere on the beach though and not just Harbour Beach Resort. I would suggest that they get some actual parking passes that hang from a mirror rather than a piece of paper that sits in the dash. I know it would have saved me a few trips to the car to double check. Overall, this is a hotel we will probably try again. The area is close enough to walk to the boardwalk. The rooms are set up perfect for an extended stay at the beach- better than a simple hotel room. The staff was friendly and the room was secure. The shape of the facility is not impeccable, but pretty good for beach front property that usually gets the wear and tear of the Ocean air. Pleasantly suprised is a good definition of our impression of this resort. We think it has great potential and we are interested to see if Westgate has any future plans for this resort.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect place to stay - not only for Bike Week”
Reviews.Author: HeidiLegau
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Harbour Beach Resort (the best little Condo's) in Unit 416. Its a nice, clean 1 Bedroom Apartment, with Livingroom, Kitchenette and Bathroom. Enough space for at least 2 People. We've been there for 4 days of Bike Week and its the perfect location. Very Close to Main Street and the Pier (walking distance). There's a breathtaking view to the ocean and we like it to sit at the balcony and listen to the waves and watching cars drive up and down the beach. Even if you go to Daytona not for Bike Week, we can highly recommend this unit. Bill (the owner or manager of the unit) was very helpful and assisting by mail in everything. We would book this location again.

Reviews.Title: “Simple but good for the area and price”
Reviews.Author: familystay10
Reviews.Content: This is not an upscale pricy hotel, but if you are on a budget and want a clean condo style hotel room with a beautiful view, great pool/jacuzzi...this is the place. There are lots of dumps in the Daytona Beach area. This one is clean (depending on which condo you get since many are privately owned).

Reviews.Title: “Westgate / Harbour Beach on Daytona Bike Week”
Reviews.Author: edtompkins
Reviews.Content: We (my wife & I) stayed at the Westgate / Harbour Beach in Daytona FL on Bike Week (March 10-16) and we had a great time during our stay. But this facility is about as average as you can get. Nothing horribly wrong with it but nothing terribly exciting about it either. For us, we traded some timeshare points to get closer to Main St without breaking the bank and this certainly fit that bill. All the rooms look mostly the same - front faces Atlantic Ave and the rear has a balcony facing the ocean. Rooms are narrow and the bedroom part was closest to the street. On Bike Week that means lots of louder MC's but for us that was ok. For others that may be a problem. There is a bar but no restaurant. Front door is unmanned and closes at 5-6PM - you will need the pool key to access the building. I have stayed at other Westgate locations and this is the low end of their offerings. Still for what it was, it was clean, uneventful (at the hotel) and got exactly what we thought it would be. For Bike Week we would go back again - if on regular vacation, I would want to upgrade. FYI - we did have free wifi service at Westgate.

Reviews.Title: “Met our Needs”
Reviews.Author: tigerinatlanta
Reviews.Content: We booked our trip thru VRBO, and the owner was very pleasant to deal with. Our Room contained a Double Bed, and a fold out couch. The room was small but well organized. Our children are very small, so we had room for one to sleep on the sofa bed, and the other in our pack in play. Being a budget the price was very reasonable for what we received, as we were not looking for something fancy just something functional. The Pool is quite spacious and was very enjoyable to use. The SPA was well maintained and served its purpose as well. The best place about this property is all rooms are ocean front. Beautiful view from the balcony. Negatives: Wi-Fi only works in lobby. Parking is a big tight. Nothing other than Pool/ SPA on property. If your needs are minimal, and you are a on a budget this is a good place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “This was terrible. Very small and very old! We are westgate owners and very dissappointed!!”
Reviews.Author: Anita M
Reviews.Content: The view is wonderful and the people were very kind and that is where the good parts end. No maidservice, No wi/fi (Lobby only and that was very poor) very small balcony and people right next door could step right over the low railing and be in your room very easy. Clean towels only on wednesday and only at certain times. No way two people can pass in this place! When you walk into the room the first thing you do is fall over the bed and then slide between the kitchen sink and the table that seats 3. The 4th person has to eat by themselves at a very small table by the tv. As a westgate owner I was so mad, they only have this one floor plan for Westgate Owners! You would think with not one, but TWO resorts in this place that it should be the top of the line! I have stayed in motels that were bigger and nicer than this! Westgate should be very ashamed of themselves! I bet the top dogs and directers of westgate do not stay there! I would like to see the man that sold us our vacation stay in this place! really?

Reviews.Title: “NICE PLACE”
Reviews.Author: S F
Reviews.Content: Family of four - two teenage boys, my husband and I. This was a nice place to stay, and for the price, who could beat it? I don't think a place to lay your head, eat breakfast, lunch and take a shower needs to be as big as the grand canyon. It was great. And the bed?! OMG, the best night of sleep I've ever had! I loved walking the beach everyday to get to the restaurants... not too close to all the attractions, yet not too far. I will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Westgate Daytona review”
Reviews.Author: drclsummer
Reviews.Content: I was concerned after reading some of the reviews prior to our trip. I have to say that I was very pleased after we arrived. Yes the suite was small. But, it was clean and well stocked. The staff were all very friendly and helpful and the pool was well maintained and spacious. The beach access was great and you can not beat the view. We stayed there with our own teenager and a teen family member. There were many things for them to do within walking distance. I would have no problem suggesting someone stay here and would be happy to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for those wanting a no-frills get-a-way”
Reviews.Author: seapup74
Reviews.Content: Beautiful ocean view from the balcony was worth the small room. But for 2 people it was perfect. An annoying maint. issue was fixed quickly. No food on site. Take a nice walk along the beach to the pier/ocean walk for good eats and drinks.

Reviews.Title: “fantastic”
Reviews.Author: spazer
Reviews.Content: i loved it verry verry clean,yes you need keys to get to the pool and inside of bld,but to me thats great less rif raf.The staff was great,the night maint man whent out of his way to make sure i got my keys back when i left them on the pool deck,not only is it comforting knowing theres someone around but having some security is a blessing.The rooms where great clean and comfortable having my kids and spouse there and there was plenty of room.Iwill be back thanks to the great staff and there hospitaliyt.

Reviews.Title: “I would reccommend others and stay again!”
Reviews.Author: Janislin63
Reviews.Content: I booked my trip through Westgate, which owns about half of the building. I was looking for a nice place to take my daughter and her friend for spring break 2011. I was a little nervous since I booked a place online last year that was a bit of a disappointment. This year was much different. The place is very secure and has been recently undergone a remodel. Our room had three rooms and two bathrooms and an ocean front balcony. I booked in advance and got 20% off. I spent less than 90 dollars a day for a beautiful place. I should warn you, you do need keys to get everywhere in the place but the pay off is that no strangers are walking up to your pool area. It's a little far to the boardwalk so if you are not up for walking, I can see where it may bother you. They do not have a restuarant or a bar...which was fine with me. I brought my own food and drinks...big deal, right? It was a family oriented place and EVERYONE was extremely helpful. Also, I was told when I checked in that they did guarentee wireless in the LOBBY but due to the age of the building they just could not tell me the service worked throughout the building. I was lucky and my internet worked great although I did see people with their laptops in the building. If that matters to you. I would still go even if I couldn't get wireless service since I don't go to the beach to be on my computer.

Reviews.Title: “Don't do it!”
Reviews.Author: MomKat2
Reviews.Content: We went to this area because the space shuttle was supposed to be going off and we could not get anything in the Titusville area for a decent price. I liked this hotel because it was beachfront and it had a kitchen, that's it. The room was so tight 2 people could not pass each other in any area, that was amazing! It was like the room was built in a hallway! Parking was a nightmare. The place had a parking lot but you risked your own life as well as the life of your car trying to get a spot! A woman put her car in reverse and backed up to get a spot before we did! When we didn't back up far enough for her to manuever, she leaped out of her car and started yelling and gesturing!!...lol...there was another car BEHIND us, we COULDN"T reverse even if we wanted to!! ...so we just sat there and watched her do backward flips with her car to get it into the spot. Another day we had parked our car only to come out and have a hotel worker yell at us that we took 'his spot and how was he supposed to fix his motorcycle if we were parked there'!!??? This was a HANDICAPPED spot and NOT marked with his personal name on it!! I could not believe this was happening! It had a fitness center but apparently that was only for owners because our key did not let us in, nor the next people who tried. What a waste. I will admit the one manager was very nice to us, but the rest? and the owners, especially the ones on the first floor?...lol...snobs is an adjective that is too nice to use. Ugh...never again, nor will I recommend the place. Run..run, run away!

Reviews.Title: “Location is everything”
Reviews.Author: westgreen123
Reviews.Content: Yes its not a 5 star but it is a good 3 star. The views out over the ocean are stunning and being able to walk from the pool area int the sea by just unlocking a gate is great. My wife and I found plenty to do in the area in particularly at the Speedway And Flea market and there are lots of places close by to visit. we found lots of places to eat out within a short car ride away and in fact we are booking for two weeks in 2011! Slight negatives, no safe in rooms which when travelling from UK means nowhere to keep passports safe also having to pay for laundry is a pain otherwise we were quite please on this our second visit.

Reviews.Title: “So glad we went and will be back next year!!”
Reviews.Author: AletaSunkel
Reviews.Content: After reading all the reviews our family was somewhat hesitant on even coming to Harbour Beach.We had read some negative feed back about the place but since we are Westgate owners and have gone to Gatlinburg 4 years in a row,we were mssing the ocean,so we thought we would try it and we are so glad we did. No,it is not a 5 star place, and no you do not have marble floors and granite counter tops and someone to carry your luggage.but if you are looking for a relaxing time on the ocean with a beautiful view,this is the place to come. The front desk were very friendly.Our place was nice and clean but it could of been bigger.All they have there is one bedroom units.We were close to everything.Pizza hut was in walking distance.Loved the pool.You do get a key to get in and out of the pool which to some may be a hassle but we do understand why they do it. We were there 7 days and almost everyday someone was trying to come up from the beach and swim,so it is nice they do have a key to get you in and out of the pool area and beach.We did not have any birds land on our balcony like we read. No loud noises.It has a family atmosphere. Now because we are Westgate owners,I do not know if certain rooms are different or they all are alike.I know at one time,Westgate only owned a few floors,but i think they now own all of it.Over all, we had a blast and we will be back next year for sure.

Reviews.Title: “the westgate resort in daytona is definately not a 5 star resort”
Reviews.Author: brad088
Reviews.Content: the employees are rude and not helpful, the elevators are extremely slow, there is no ac in the hallways. it is not a 5 star resort not even a 4 star i would say its a 3 star resort. there is nothing to do in daytona other than the beach, there are very few dining options, no attractions or entertainment.

Reviews.Title: “Great resort-Clean and adorable!!!”
Reviews.Author: rubyredNewYork
Reviews.Content: I visited the resort with my family from March 21st thru March 28th of this year.The resort was easy to find and when we went inside-we couldn't believe how nice it was.It was soooo clean! There were 6 of us so the resort gave us 2 condos on the 4th floor-405 and 407.They were clean and the setup was perfect for us!My parents are in their 80"s and found the resort easy for them to get around. The rooms overlook the ocean and the balconeys were cleaned often to remove the bird dodo.The staff were so helpful.The location is very good.We would come back to this resort again! Enjoy your stay!

Reviews.Title: “If you love the beach you will love Harbour Beach (Westgate)”
Reviews.Author: jaccOntario
Reviews.Content: We own at Westgate Vacation Villas is Kissemmee. we stayed here 4 years ago and fell in love with the beach. There were 4 adults the first time and it was a little cramped. The patio was surrouned by a high wall and the chairs were short so you had to stand to see the beach. My husband and I came back, by ourselves this time, and the upgrades they mentioned were happening are mostly done. The balconies have been fixed the walls are gone and there are nice new railings, the sliding doors have been replaced as well. There is a new front desk for Westgate customers and it is staffed from 9 am until 11 pm. Very friendly as all other Westgate location employees have been. Everything was clean and well maintained. The bathrooms were spotless as was everything in the kitchen. The other reviews I read were much older and the work that has been done has brought this resort close to the standards of several others. It is not the same and should not be a distination in-it's self as some resorts are. This is an adult friendly resort and we love it. LOCATION, LOCATION, LOCATION. We can see the Daytona Beach Pier from out balcony,and walk from the pool area directly onto the beach.

Reviews.Title: “This is the worst place ever!!!! The costumer service is awfull!”
Reviews.Author: makemesick
Reviews.Content: We've been owners now for 15 yrs. And it's only getting worse. Last year we were'nt allowed in our BOUGHT AND PAID FOR ground floor unit which cost us an EXTRA 1000.00. Because, "they were doing work in the room". LOL, funny cuz we went down there mid-week and FOUND and TALKED TO a bunch of MOTORCROSS kids in there!!!!!!! OUR ROOM! We were then charged an extra 150.00 for a screw that we had our neighbor remove from the balcony door, (as my husband does not smoke) so me and my gf smoked on the balcony. Now we're being told on the phone by customer service that, that incident didnt happen w/ the motorcross kids. Hmmm....Funny! Cuz my husband and I were there! Talking to them! Dont ever rent from this hotel! They'll treat you like garbage, they'll take every kind of advantage of you and charge for every little thing. 150.00 for a screw??? Are ya kiddin me???? It's too bad that we BOUGHT THIS FROM WEST GATE RESORTS! But then again, the guy running the place didnt have his head stuck up his [--], and would never let this sort of crap be done!!!! Be sure to tell your friends NEVER stay at this place!!!! Infact WARN them...It's just a rip off!!!! We love Bike Week, and if it wasnt for Bike Week, we'd never ever ever go back!

Reviews.Title: “Room 202, Stay away!!!”
Reviews.Author: travelfun88
Reviews.Content: We were expected to stay in a cute little place by the ocean during our last stay in Florida. Nothing fancy but clean. We rented the place from the owner directly. While booking on the phone the owner made it sounds like the place is well kept. But during our 3 days stay in room 202, it was a horrible experience. 1. Bath tub is extremely dirty, the drain stopper was not even on, and it is sitting on the edge of the tub. Water does not drain properly, so as you shower, you'll see dirty, yucky, blackish stuff comes back from the drain. Very disgusting. 2. No remote control in the room, the owner would not tell you until you were in the room and call her and ask where the remote is, she would tell you the previous guest accidentally took it away. TV only has few antenna channels (with poor reception). 3. The room smells like somebody has been smoking in there for a long time. 4. We did not use their towels until our last day, coming home; both my son and I get rashes on our body from using their towels. 5. There is no air condition in the hallway and the room is adjacent to the trash dumpster, so it always smells bad. 6. During booking, when asked about internet connection, the owner told us sometimes there may not be good reception. But during our stay, we tried many time, we were not able to connect to the internet even once. Overall, the place is filthy and unhygienic, After called the owner and reported the problems, she acts like all are new to her and showed no intention to correct the issues. It is shocking a room in such a filthy condition is still not pulled out of the market. Please do not rent the place for your health and your loved ones’. Please do not let those lovely pictures on their website mislead you.

Reviews.Title: “Too cramped for a family of four”
Reviews.Author: happytrailsOcala_Fl
Reviews.Content: Says it's sleeps 4 however 2 of you should be little kids. My husband , myself, a 23 year old and a 14 year old. Way too cramped. Good for 2 but that's it. Great location, Nice pool. Just ok....next time I will spend the extra money and get a better hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: docqette
Reviews.Content: My husband and I traded our Westgate time share in Orlando for the resort in Daytona. Now it may not be anywhere as fancy like the property we have in Orlando, but it was still a very nice condo and we enjoyed our stay very much. We had a king size bed ( very compfy) with a large dresser/wall unit with colour tv.and a full bathroom with hot tub and shower right off of it. Next to that was an entrance to the kitchen which included table and chairs, stove, micorwave, fride, dishwasher, toaster, coffee maker and coffee and a kettle. A complete set of glass dishes, stainless steel cutlery, pots and pans, can opener, wine bottle opener, broom with dust pan and cooking utensils. Everything was very clean . The living roon had a lovely sofa that opened up into a double bed if needed and it had a coffee table, lamps, desk, wall unit with a colour tv. The rooms don't have internet connection but we had no problem with a wireless. There was a second bathroom with a glass shower which was handy when we both needed to get washed up after the beach. The living room opened up with glass patio doors onto a balcony with an awesome view of the beach. Complete with plastic chairs and small stool/table. All rooms face the ocean and mornings were expecially nice watching the sun come up over the ocean while enjoying breakfast or a cup of coffee. The bathrooms were well stocked with toilet paper, kleenex, towels, face cloths, beach towels and hair dryer. The kitchen had a supply of dishsoap, dishwsher soap and paper towels. The only thing we had to supply was shampoo and food. The building is old but well maintained. We had a broken vertical blind in the living room and a burnt out light. We told the desk in the evening and by the next day it was all fixed. Overall the resort was great, the desk folk were freindly and helpful and we would definately go back again.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad for the price”
Reviews.Author: Lizast
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here mid-July and found it to be satisfactory to our needs, i.e. a relaxing vacation at the beach. The hotel is not new but also not old and dingy either. We stayed here for $79 a night for an oceanfront and were pleased with what we got. The view was great, nothing better than looking out on the ocean! The pool was great, big enough for the kids AND adults to swim in. Also, when we were there the hot tub was working fine. The hotel is also located in a convenient location, close to the restaurants and shops, but not on top of all the loud action at night. We did bring our bikes, which made getting around Daytona a breeze. It did appear that the hotel was being worked on, which is a good thing, but we were not disturbed by any noise or by workers. Lastly, regarding posts about pigeons..yes they were present, but name somewhere near the water especially an ocean front that does not have them.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad”
Reviews.Author: Danni415
Reviews.Content: My two friends and I just recently stayed at Harbour in a privately owned 6th floor condo. When driving up, it was apparent that construction was being done to some of the porches on one side of the building. Walking in, the building seemed a little outdated but seemed taken care of. The pool is definitely a plus. There's lots of chairs to lay out in and tables to eat at. The pool is not always clean of bugs though. Also, because of work on it, the hottub was only open half of the week we stayed. Our room was very nice and taken care of. The only thing we didn't like was the porch. There definitely is a pigeon problem here. Even without feeding the pigeons, they constantly are walking on the porches and there was a large pile of droppings in the corner of our porch, hidden by a plant. It was pretty disgusting. We had a problem with construction noise. Every morning at 8:00 AM, construction began. It wasn't even happening on our floor but sounded like a jackhammer was going into the floor above us. We ended up complaining about his and were told that construction will be going on 8:00 AM - 4:00 PM for a year. If I ever were to come back, it will definitely be after a year. If you are looking to go out at night, waking up at 8:00 each day isn't too much fun. Overall, our experience was good. There are several things that need to be worked on at this place, but it seems like they are moving in the right direction.

Reviews.Title: “Not the ritz, but not a bad place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: TravelingTamela
Reviews.Content: My husband and I booked a one bedroom villa through a Westgate owner at Harbour Beach Resort. While the exterior appearance of the resort was disappointing, the interior parts that I saw were not bad at all! The staff was very friendly and helpful. I did see on a bulletin board a memo from the Condo Owners Association to the condo owners at the resort that there was going to be an exterior rennovation of the resort, and they are in the process of voting for various rennovations. There were constantly people there doing some type of work on the resort, but it did not seem to interfere with the guests' enjoyment of the resort. We were in room 103 and it was spacious, clean and was located on the first floor right by the pool. I did see a few pigeons, but never saw evidence of any pigeon droppings around the pool area or on any of the first floor patios. The furniture in the living room area was comfortable and clean. The bed was huge! The pool area was beautiful and clean. There was a nice hot tub and plenty of beach chairs and tables. The pool hours were from 7 a.m. to 12 p.m., which was a little frustrating when we tried to sleep in a couple of days after being up late. On the other side of the pool was the beach, which was beautiful, clean and not really very crowded. My only complaints about the room were that the television in the bedroom did not work, the kitchen light was burnt out upon arrival and one of the slats from the vertical blinds in the bedroom kept falling, leaving a small gap, making it necessary for me to change clothes in the bathroom or the living room. These are minor complaints and would not deter me from recommending the resort or returning myself. Maintenance did fix the kitchen light but advised us that the television was broken and that new tvs were on order. Fortunately the television in the living room worked so we weren't totally without tv the entire trip and were able to keep track of the storms at sea, which never caused us one day's worth of bad weather. There were two bathrooms - a small bathroom with a stand-up shower in the bedroom, and a bathroom off of the living room with a jacuzzi tub. I saw no mold in either bathroom and both were very clean. The kitchen was well stocked with dishes, a toaster, paper towls, microwave, stove, etc. and the refrigerator had an ice maker, which was nice. Overall, we had a great time and I can honestly say I would stay at this resort again.

Reviews.Title: “dirty and bugs very rude”
Reviews.Author: skneal
Reviews.Content: This is the worst place i have ever stayed. The night before we stayed in a Motel 6 and it was like staying in the Hilton compared to this place. The people were rude, you couldn't get any service and when you ask its like you are bothering them!! The door said that they would be locked at 7:oopm to 7:00 am, we got back to the hotel at a little after 6:00 pm and we were locked out!! no one to call had 2 small children and we had to wait for someone to come out. It was very dirt. We had a mouse eat our bread and my youngest was scared of the cockroches!! When i complained i was told this is Florida we have cockroches. In other words oh well. The sliding doors wouldn't work. We couldn't wash clothes because you needed special cards and they were out of them. The rooms were dirty and we left early. Kim Indiana

Reviews.Title: “Westgate needs to take this location off the map....”
Reviews.Author: Greg K
Reviews.Content: My wife and I are owners at the Westgate in Gatlinburg, TN, and if anyone has been there they know it's great. It is VERY nice. This was my wife and I one year wedding anniversary and we wanted to go to the beach, so we exchanged our week to the Westgate in Daytona Beach. Let me tell you, this place in Daytona is a DUMP. Westgate needs to sell their space there and move out. I'm actually typing this up from the Cocunut Palm Spring resort in New Symrna Beach, just south of Daytona. I called Westgate and complained and they got Interval on the phone, and they moved me down here. The customer service Westgate and Interval provided was great, they were very responsive and willing to make it right. I'll never go back to Westgate Daytona Beach. Not only is the building rough, the whole area around it is rough. Stay away from here, stay away from Daytona all together. Trust me....

Reviews.Title: “Dirty”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Sometimes a review can be pretty helpful to others....I hope this one is helpful , because I'll tell you... The management there is rude and really dosen't want to get up fom her chair to accomodate you. Towels were a NO NO if you needed any. "QUOTE": You'll have to wait till Wednesday...NO one gets new towels till Wednesday!" Now, that may not be rude to some people, but it was a greeting like " NOW what do you want?" in her eyes. Construction is good. you always need improvements, but by gosh...TELL us before hand! I sat out on my patio and nearly had a broken piece of cement hit me from the roof. Ya, I know, what kinda lunk head would sit under construction workers? Well, i wasn't really near them, they were actually 5 units away. This had to be a stray one. Housekeeping is terrible. They had their "Cleaning staff" clean our room before we checked in...... I'm just wondering if these people know how to use cleaning fluids and a mop? The floors were terrible and the walls had some kind of food stain on them near the table. I ended up cleaning the floors myself because I couldn't stand the the stickyness and leftover gunk on the floor from the previous tenant. It's very hard to recommend this place to anyone unles you're looking for just a place to sleep at night and be out of the room all day. Good luck, but if you stay in Daytona Beach, go down the road a ways and get into one of the 5 star places. You'll be glad you did.

Reviews.Title: “Great family place!!”
Reviews.Author: Jessie100
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed ( family of 5) at Harbour Beach Resort in the month of June. We booked through the front desk( Angela is a gem) and our stay was wonderful. We recieved daily maid service and had a beautiful ocean front room.The room was very clean and the balcony was great. The pool is one of the largest I've come across, and my children loved it! The beach and pool areas are locked so I didn't feel like I was sharing the pool with a bunch of people off the beach that didn't belong, which happened at another hotel before. There is also a free park directly next door that had a huge play area and water streams that shoot up from the ground and a volley ball court. My kids loved it and it helped cut down the cost of the vacation and gave us some nice variety. The only downside to this condo/hotel was that we did not have more vacation time!! We will be back soon, Thanks for a wonderful stay!

Reviews.Title: “Pool was nice...when you could get to it.....”
Reviews.Author: billkimas
Reviews.Content: I have never been to a Westgate like this one..... Day 1 - arrive and go to office, located next to a CLOSED down Denny's....I had read on the message board that you could only get new clean towels and sheets on Wednesdays...when I questioned the person in the "office" about this she stated that is correct...there were 6 towels and 6 wash clothes in each room and you could come down for more on Wed....well when there are four in your party this would mean that you would each have one for the next 5 days...not sure about you but I use a clean one each day to wash my face..... Night of day 1 - there is a large bed in one of the rooms as well as a pull out sofa in the "living" room....my son was sleeping on this...about 2 in the morning he woke us up to tell us that he had fleas on him...sure enough...the bed was infested with fleas...not sand fleas but fleas from an animal. I called the 24 hour number the next morning and the person that called back was very nice....when we went to the "office" to meet with the person on duty the next morning she acted like we were an inconvience to her...not sure how that was but she also insisted that they were not fleas in my sons head...but sand fleas...having owned animals in the past I tried to explain to her that I knew the difference....she stated that I did not understand...I have the fleas in a plastic baggie to show her....but....dumb person that I am I was wrong and really making them have to work for the day...she offered to try to find me another room when I asked them to remove the couch and bring in a new one...why should I have to move...just bring me a new couch....well they did arrrive about 2-3 in the afternoon to replace the matterass in the couch and even brought CLEAN sheets.... While the maintance man was there I mentioned that the ice machine in the freezer did not work - we had to purchase ice....as none of the ice machines had any in the building....he proceeded to tell me that it HAD to work, he just put in a new one...I advised him WELL it did not....as he then looked to check and make sure I knew what I was talking about.....that night my husband pulled the ref out and they had forgotten to hook the water back up...huh, that could be why it did not work... As my title says, the pool was very nice...only problem with that was that you needed a key to access the pool from inside the building as well as the beach....this was a hugh inconvience if there were several in your party as you only received one key and needed it at all times. On the 2nd day there, the lock to get to the beach did not work, so maintance came out and taped the lock so that we could all access the beach from the pool...well now I know why it was important to keep it locked...we had all kinds of guest from the beach enjoy our pool that day as well... All I can say is NEVER again..... And yes, there were a large colonie of sand fleas that lived in our room too.....what a trip.

Reviews.Title: “Private owners are the way to go here!”
Reviews.Author: flaorbust
Reviews.Content: Don't even think about renting from the front desk in this place! They don't answer the phones, so you can't even get a reservation! We found a private owner, Stephanie Jones, who rents 4 units there. We stayed in 501, and our friends stayed in 809. Both units were great. 501 was spacious, clean, and the view was totally awesome! I will never try to rent from anyone but a private owner again!! Mrs. Jones took care of our every need! We ran out of clean towels, and she had the cleaner there within 1/2 an hour. She could have told us to sit on it and go to the darn laundry room, but that sure wasn't the case! The units were nicely furnished, well lit, comfortable, clean, and had an awesome view. The complex itself leaves a lot to be desired, so our room was our little heaven from the cruel world below.

Reviews.Title: “Not your typical Westgate experience”
Reviews.Author: getouthere
Reviews.Content: We've stayed at other Westgate properties; usually they are spacious, well decorated, are fully furnished including the kitchen items and all amenities are above average. This property wasn't quite what I expected. Because this property is not entirely a Westgate property, upon arrival you have to find the manager in a small room off to the side (because most units are condo units owned independently, there is no front desk or receptionist to help you). Frequently, there is simply a sign on this door "Out to Lunch---back at 1PM" or "Back in 10 minutes". One guest standing at the door had been waiting for over half an hour for the 10 minute sign. There is just one person on duty at a time. The manager, the person who cleaned our room and maintenance man were all very nice. I must add, however, the TV did not work properly (sometimes not at all) and I called or stopped down to the office every day, but in the almost two weeks we were there, we never got the new TV they promised. There is no maid service, no fresh towels/sheets everyday and no washer/dryer in the room. We had to go down a floor to access the one washer/two dryers available and they are not free. There is a towel/sheet exchange on Wed morning so we shlepped everything down to the 1st floor to get some fresh ones. On Saturday, our room was cleaned and we got fresh towels. We had planned on having 2 relatives stop over for dinner one night, but after we arrived to find the size of the room, we decided to go out to dinner. Tiny, tiny, tiny kitchen: there was not enough seating for 4 people (only a small table for 2 attached to the wall). There was a stove/oven, fridge, microwave and dish washer. We guessed in a former life these units were small hotel rooms. The bathroom was nice--looked like relatively new tile work; however, the shower leaked and dripped all night long. Really nice water pressure in the shower. But no place to hang up your towels---no towel rack at all. There was a tiny hook on the back of the bathroom door, but so small everything fell off it. They REALLY need to do something about that. (And with no washer/dryer in the unit, there was absolutely no place to dry your beach towels either--that was quite a nuisance) The pool was nice and big. The temperature is kept very cool (we wished it was a lot warmer) and there is a nice jacuzzi. Both are kept in tip-top shape. It is unfortunate that this 8 story building casts it's shadow over the pool; all the guests by the afternoon are crowded into one small area that still has sun. The front sliding glass doors at the entrance lock from 6PM to 7AM with good reason. Twice when unlocking these doors, someone appeared from parking lot and snuck in behind me as I opened the doors. There were unsavory characters in the area and many police cars were noted. I enjoy walking the beach in early morning/after dinner and was very uncomfortable walking alone here. I only walked down the street once (as opposed to taking the beach) down to the Pier; I didn't want to walk that alone even with my pepper spray (thankfully I inadvertently left it in my purse when packing). Daytona has one of the nicest beaches in Florida I have ever been to and I've been all over, but as much as I like Westgate properties and the beach here, I won't revisit this one.

Reviews.Title: “What a place!”
Reviews.Author: bayview6
Reviews.Content: I can understand the split nature of the reviews of this Westgate. First, the place was built about 35 years ago and the exterior/elevators of the bldg shows its age. The place is funky with its faux portholes on the room doors. The Denny's is no longer there. Defintely not those seeking an "up scale" resort. However, the rooms have been re-modeled and provide a modern environment. I especially like the brick pool/hot tub area. The rooms are right on the ocean and that is its best feature. The area around the hotel is in transition but acceptable. I would stand there again because we all had an enjoyable vacation. Good value for the dollar.

Reviews.Title: “Loved Harbor Beach Club!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We always rent from Stephanie Jones who books for many of the private owners there at Harbor. This time we brought our extended family, so we needed a larger place with more room. Unit 501 had a king bed, queen, and 2 single pullouts in the living room, 2 bathrooms, full separate kitchen, and it was plenty spacious for the six of us. I love the decor, which Ms. Jones designed herself. It's sort of 'retro' and very colorful. We loved it so much, we're going to request it every time we return. The unit was immaculate, the resort is great, and the proximity to everything is wonderful. It's only a short walk up the beach to the pier and boardwalk, there are grocery stores within a mile, and more restaurants than I could count. The view from the huge balcony in the living room and picture windows in the bedroom was awesome! There's also a park next door with cooking grills, an interactive water park for little kids, basketball, volleyball, and a fantastic play area for young ones. You may read many negative comments about the Harbor, but if you rent from private owners, especially Ms. Jones, you'll never go wrong!

Reviews.Title: “I need a vacation from my vacation”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We rented a condo (motel room) from an individual owner for the week of July 2-9. The pictures on the internet looked great, the building was described as a newer building. (maybe in the 70's) .. when we arrived there was no luggage carriers to haul your luggage up on. The elevators were nasty and also in one of these the expiration date was 8/2004. made us feel very comfortable, also the elevetors had no air. we arrived on Saturday 7-2-05 the owner met us there, the room was a dissapointment. there was no headboards, beds were to be queen size but they were full size. the sliding glass doors that lead to the balcony were very hard to open. The pictures on the internet showed this place decorated with stylish pictures, curtains, etc. The owner said that everything got damaged from the hurricanes last summer. How long does it take to remodel a 16x30 room? They have a service desk but unless you are renting directly from harbor beach they wiil not help you with anything. but even then they leave at 6pm after that you have to use a pool key to get in any of the doors. also you need to pool key to go anywhere in this resort.We had one pool key and one room key for a family with (2) teenagers. I was so tired after a week of running up and down the hall to let one of the kids out to the pool and then having to run back to the door to unlock it so they could get back into the building. The lobby was not cleaned until about wednesday. I think that was the first day we saw any employees anywhere.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Harbour Beach resort during Bike Week (5-12 March 2005). We rented the condo directly from the owner (unit #601). The management at the hotel was so-so. But we managed on our own just fine. They have a huge pool (heated) and a fairly good sized jacuzzi. Our room was very clean, and the decor was great. The best thing about this hotel is it's location. It's about a 5-6 block walk to Main street. We had no problem with parking. All in it was a nice place to stay. Oh...and they have a Denny's on the bottom floor with is 24hrs.

Reviews.Title: “Not even close to what I expected”
Reviews.Author: 8t8keys
Reviews.Content: I stayed here January 25th and 26th of 2005. I so love the Westgate Resorts in the Orlando area that I figured this would have the same standards but it was not even close. First, this is not a Westgate property but really the Harbor Beach in which Westgate has purchased some units. The hallways are dark, there is a warning in the laundry room about your clothes being stolen and neither dryer worked. If you want to get to your room after 6 PM you have to go through the adjoining Denny's restaurant to get into the building. Having grown up in Daytona I realize what a hurricane can do but a lot of what I dealt with had nothing to do with the hurricanes. The door to the patio would not open, light bulbs missing in several lamps, rude and uncaring staff, and chipped tiles on the floors just to name a few. The elevators were filthy with open electrical panels. In all fairness the unit was clean (not the dishes) but that is about the only good thing I can say about it.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed our stay”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed on the 7th Floor Memorial Day Weekend. The unit was very clean & we were well pleased with our stay. Will be back.

Reviews.Title: “Great deal for the money”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We've stayed at the Westgate Daytona 2 times already and are going back in a couple of months..I've been going to Daytona for over 10 years and always stay in suites...we weren't sure what to expect but we took a chance were very pleased..you can't find a better value for your money...you can't find many rooms with a full kitchen, 2 baths and a balcony for a better price..I would and have recommended Westgate Daytona to family and friends

Reviews.Title: “4th of july 2004”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Rented #819 - Top floor, corner unit. Condo-like. Nice clean 1 bedroom king with separate living room & kitchen. All tiled, and new furnishings. Great view of the beach, strip and board walk. Great pool, great location. Will definately stay again. July 4th was a blast!

Reviews.Title: “Rent from owners!”
Reviews.Author: krv
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I just returned from a week at the Harbour Beach Resort (6/26 - 7/03/04) and thoroughly enjoyed it! We rented from an owner and our room had been redecorated, complete with new kitchen appliances and bathroom. The resort is older, but most of the resorts/hotels in Daytona Beach are. The Harbour Beach has a large pool for the size of the resort and it's kept clean, and heated! We enjoyed the fact that the pool is oceanfront also. Overall, a nice place to stay...just rent from an owner!

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We read positive review for unit 519 and rented it for a week in April 2004. The unit was quite clean and well decorated and provided all the amenities of home. We had a great view of the beach and the Pier. The pool was nice and the facilities for the most part were satisifactory. ...the management at the hotel was a little iffy, but if your independent and can manage on your own, you should do fine. ...Get to the deck chairs early though, or you will be sitting on the deck. Some people sneak down (around 6 am) and put towels on the chairs to "reserve" them....Sneaky...! ..All in all, pick a good clean unit and you will have a blast....

Reviews.Title: “Stay Away!!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We exchanged through timeshare to stay at the Westgate resort (same place as Harbour) and were EXTREMELY disappointed! This should not even be an OPTION to the people who have MORTGAGED tens of thousand of dollars in timeshare! The rooms were nasty, if I sat on the green leather couch I was sure to put a towel down first, I bought tub cleaner to clean the jet tub, bought a king sheet to replace theirs and never used their one-ply comforter, had to plea with the 5-12 year-olds there to use the hot tub, and yes the elevators were resurrected from the Titanic and never cleaned. Ladies, if you walk through the lobby on the way to the pool, please cover up b/c the employees WILL stare I promise. Speaking of the lazy employees (Im not positive they were even employees because they never DID anything), they were always sitting out front smoking and laughing (almost certainly at you) and one guy asked in reference to my husbands truck which has Nascar decals on it "Hey, buddy, do you work for Nascar?" all my husband could think to say was "No, they just let me drive the truck." (We could not believe he had nothing better to do! Go clean something!) Please! If you go to Daytona, DO NOT waste your money at this place. Save up if you must and get a nice hotel that has a chain name. The HOJO up the street is nice (Stayed there too) and I'm sure the Holiday Inn must be better than this. Oh yeah, there was a group of kids who mysteriously appeared from nowhere (no luggage, etc) and used the pool, beach and most of the lounge chairs all day long on a SATURDAY, had a ground floor room with direct access to the pool from the sliding glass door (which Im sure may have been a nicer room than the dump they put us in!). I noticed on the "Dad" of the group's shirt that he was an employee at the resort and was outraged that he would take up what might have a slight chance at being a nicer room for his kid to have a party! STAY AWAY FROM THE HARBOUR/WESTGATE RESORT IN DAYTONA!!!!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Was there in Jan 04 - Great place”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I was at Harbour Beach Resort in January. The location is great - near to everything and you're right there on the beach - it's wonderful! and they also have the biggest pool on the beach. The room (#517) was clean and inviting. There's a balcony with a great view! I feel your best bet is to rent through an owner, you get a much nicer room. I have booked the room again for next year.

Reviews.Title: “Great View, Clean Unit, Great Rates, but Rent by Owner”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Understand that Harbour Beach is a hotel that has been turned into condos. The rooms are individually owned and vary in decorating, furnishings, cleanliness and size. Your best bet is to rent directly by owner. The front desk program has changed managers several times over the past years and most owners do not rent through them. Unfortunately, the ones that do are the some of the worst units. The location is great and the pool and pool deck is one of the largest on the beach. Most units face the ocean and a Denny's restaurant is located off the lobby, which I find very convenient. Again, don't judge all units by one and rent from an owner. I highly recommend units 601, 519 and 516.

Reviews.Title: “Repulsive”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Elevators were excavated from the Titanic and never cleaned. Guests are allowed to put their garbage outside their room doors into the hall and nobody seems to care or collect it. The pool is large and pretty but cold and dirty. Now for the whipped cream and cherry; the staff never seems to do anything, but never has time to help the guest, the front desk and ?General Manager? are argumentative, rude, and inept. Everybody makes mistakes and this was a doozy. Never again.

Reviews.Title: “Stay Away!!!!”
Reviews.Author: devonae
Reviews.Content: The website makes it looks so good! The place was a dump! They should have paid us to stay there & then apologize. Stay away!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hot Tub and Pool”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Harbour Beach Resort for 2 nights just before Christmas. We were able to check in early (about 1 or 1:30 pm). Went up to the room and the security lock was broken. Called and they moved us immediately into another room. We were on the 8th floor and overlooked the ocean. Never having done this before I was pretty impressed. They have a great pool and hot tub on site. These are a necessity when I travel. I would probably not go back, but that is because I never stay at the same place twice. I would recommend for an okay place to stay. My biggest complaint has to do with Jeb Bush and the no smoking where there is food. There was a nice little bar here, however you had to go outside to smoke. This is worse than the Minnesota Clean Indoor Air Act at home.

Reviews.Title: “Dump hotel”
Reviews.Author: globetrottermtl
Reviews.Content: This place is not a good hotel. Besides its location which is right next to Denny`s this place has not done any renovations from the 1970`s.One other problem is that the elevator at the harbour is the slowest elevator I have ever seen it takes nearly 5 minutes to get up to the 8th floor where we were. I do not understand that the staff doesn`t get why there is pigeon **** all over the place. This place is highly unsanitary. The mattresses on the beds felt like there wasn't a spring left in them and were covered with plastic. Beleive me do not make a reservation here you will be very disappointed

Reviews.Title: “Not What We Expected!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We were surprized to find out that the Westgate Resort is in fact the Harbour Club of Daytona Beach. Westgate only owns part of the building so you are not provided with any onsite assistance for problems. While our room was spacious and with a nice view of the ocean it had its share of problems. The biggest problem was no maid service. We had the oppurtunity to receive clean towles and other necessary supply replacement only once per week. If you dirtied all towles before that time you could wash them in a provided laundry room out of your pocket. If you ran out of other supplies you had to go to the Westgate office to get more (the office is only open 8-5). The floor in our room was filthy and dresser drawers broken. The oven didn't heat properly and we found a cockroach in our shower. Our air conditioner didn't work most of the time. We spoke to the manager of Westgate but our air was never fixed. The resort boasts child activities and beach volleyball, neither was found on the premisis. Our experience at the Westgate Resort is not one we will ever repeat.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid Like the Plague!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Hotel was filthy: There was mildew and scum in the bathrooms, and huge cockroaches and palmetto bugs. The linen felt used and the floors were coated with a slimy film. We couldn't shower without wearing rubber flip-flops - going barefoot inside was out of the question. The stench from the attached Denny's was unbearable and permeated the public areas and the rooms. The rooms were tiny: you couldn't open the fridge or the dishwasher without touching the other end of the kitchenette's hallway.No maid service, even for a week's stay. The surrounding area is also run down - there were homeless on both sides of the hotel, in the adjoining public park and in the next door parking lot. They pan-handled outside of the entrance, and sometimes even came into the lobby. The noise from the compressors never ended. Truly hell on earth.

Reviews.Title: “pleasant family trip”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Westgate from July 22-25 2003. The room was nice for the price. I did alot of research on the internet and found this to be a good deal for what you got. We did not make it to the Denny's on site because there we so many other places to go and see. The one downfall was there seemed to be a lot of homeless in the area.

Reviews.Title: “bad time westgate”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: When we were at Westgate there were hardly ever any westgate employees there. We didn't have an alarm clock in our room and we had no clean towels the whole week that we were there. Our room was not cleaned and there was no cleaning supplies left there for me to clean with. I had to go buy a dust mop and dust pan so that I could clean the room myself. What they don't tell you is that westgate is in the same hotle as Harbor Beach and the Harbor Beach employees are rude if you are Westgate guest. Our son and his family went with us and they were put four rooms away from us, so don't count on connecting rooms are even rooms that are side by side. Futher more I smoke and we ask for a smoking room. Instead of being honest and saying that they have no smoking rooms they took the resevation and let us find out after we got there that all they offer are non smoking rooms. Of course with the cancelatin policy that they have you are stuck with the reservation that you have made. Never mind that they were not up front and honest. About the only thing good was that there were two bathrooms and two televisions. That came in real handy since we had the grandkids traveling with us. The grandkids were the reason that I needed the cleaning supplies and dust mop.

Reviews.Title: “Great time!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The hotel was clean with a Denny's Restaurant on site. Our room looked almost like a brand new room with a whirlpool and 5' walk-in shower. We had a oceanfront view for a very reasonable price. We were right beside Splash Park and the pier was in eye distance. I will go back to this hotel again in the near future. Consider buying a condo here. Excellent staff and had a great time.

Reviews.Title: “Harbor Beach Needs Help”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: There was not adequate security. Rooms shabbily built/maintained. A door three rooms down slams and you think a gun went off in your room. Could hear someone bouncing a "golf" ball upstairs. Desk has an attitude and was argumentative with guests. Someone stole our balcony chairs and they would do nothing about it. Could not leave the door open to hear the ocean because they did not shut down the pool at 11 pm as they said was done and people were yelling and screaming in the pool till 4AM. Got calls from the front desk about renting our room, which we had paid for the entire weekend. Then the next day, people knocked and kicked on our room and demand that they had rented the room. Neither the desk or Westgate (who also rents there) would take responsibility for the problem. Beer and wine bottles at the pool. Garbage sitting in the hallway. Our restful weekend...NOT!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Pool/View/Tile floors”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed on 8th floor. Hotel was very quiet and clean. No deposit taken as I used a credit card. Room appeared to be newly redecorated with tile floor. Real convienent with Denny's on ground floor. Would recommend for couples and families. Room had all kitchen appliances. Pool is big and clean, but was too cold when there for us to swim.

Reviews.Title: “Rip off Plaza”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This place is a rip off. They quoted us a price for rooms and took an advance deposit. When everyone checked out and paid their bills our $385 deposit was not refunded. Having to go to small claims court to get it back. MANY OTHER PLACES TO STAY - DON'T GO HERE! Rooms were filthy and no clean towels, maid service or anything without begging them!!

HotelInfo.Name: Harbour Beach Resort
HotelInfo.Address: 701 South Atlantic Avenue, Daytona Beach, FL 32118 (Formerly Westgate Daytona Beach)
